We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the behavior of the boy suggest Tourette syndrome, which is characterized by repetitive, involuntary movements and vocalizations called tics. Coprolalia, or the utterance of socially inappropriate words, is a common symptom in Tourette syndrome. A 3 Hz spike-wave pattern on EEG is associated with absence seizures, not Tourette syndrome. Severe atrophy of the caudate and putamen is seen in Huntington disease, not Tourette syndrome. X-linked MECP2 mutation with female predominance is associated with Rett syndrome, which is not related to the symptoms presented by the patient.
